bioghist.p: K. Laurence Stapleton (1911-1998) was the chair of the English department at Bryn Mawr College from 1954 to 1965. She received her bachelor's degree from Smith College in 1932. She studied at the University of London and came to Bryn Mawr as an Instructor of English in 1934. In addition to her service in the English department, she was the acting chair of the Political Science department from 1949 to 1951. She retired in 1980. She was the author of Design of Democracy, and Marianne Moore, the Poet's Advance.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of K. Laurence Stapleton. Included are Stapleton's files from Bryn Mawr's English department, such as sample exams for English courses (1950s-1960s); correspondence with applicants for positions at the college; class lists and grades; and student poems. The collection also includes manuscripts of Stapleton's writings, including The Citizen and the Community; correspondence with publishers; and research notes.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
